attributes.action: Improve the signage of Bus Lane on Oxford Road Manchester and refund the victims
attributes.additional_details:
As per the Manchester Evening News:

743 Oxford Road bus lane driving appeals put on hold over 'inadequate' signs

More than 300,000 penalty notices were issued in less than a year at the three locations within the bus gate scheme

https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/greater-manchester-news/bus-lane-fines-oxford-road-15906469

There are NO words "Bus Lane" marked on the road. As per their Bus Lane Rules:

https://secure.manchester.gov.uk/info/471/tickets_and_fines/698/bus_lane_rules
attributes.background:
Signs that appear to apply to the cycle lane that actually apply to the entire road.

Signs are behind other signs and are hidden from the driver as you approach the restriction.

Manchester City Council fails to list "inadequate signage" as "Grounds for appeal" to the Traffic Penalty Tribunals

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.
	
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
